text: The 1972 Arkansas gubernatorial election was held on November 7, 1972. Incumbent Democratic Governor Dale Bumpers defeated Republican nominee Len E. Blaylock with 75.44% of the vote. ==Primary elections== Primary elections were held on May 30, 1972. ===Democratic primary=== ====Candidates==== *Dale Bumpers, incumbent Governor *George W. Davis *Les Gibbs *Mack Harbour *Q. Byrum Hurst, State Senator ====Results==== Bumpers avoided a run-off (which would have been held 13 June) by winning with more than 50% of the vote. ===Republican primary=== ====Candidates==== *Len E. Blaylock, former staffer for Winthrop Rockefeller ====Results==== ==General election== ===Candidates=== *Dale Bumpers, Democratic *Len E. Blaylock, Republican ===Results=== ==References== ==Bibliography== * * * 1972 Arkansas Gubernatorial Category:November 1972 events in the United States
title: 1972 Arkansas gubernatorial election
